verses.verse: (For the choir director. [A Psalm] of David the servant of the Lord.) Transgression <S%H6588><s%> speaks <S%H5002><s%> to the ungodly <S%H7563><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> his heart; <S%H3820><s%> There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> fear <S%H6343><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> his eyes. <S%H5869><s%>
For it flatters <S%H9140><s%> him in his [own] eyes, <S%H5869><s%> Concerning the discovery <S%H4672><s%> of his iniquity <S%H5771><s%> [and] the hatred <S%H8130><s%> [of it.]

The words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> are wickedness <S%H205><s%> and deceit; <S%H4820><s%> He has ceased <S%H2308><s%> to be wise <S%H7919><s%> [and] to do <S%H3190><s%> good. <S%H3190><s%>

He plans <S%H2803><s%> wickedness <S%H205><s%> upon his bed; <S%H4904><s%> He sets <S%H3320><s%> himself on a path <S%H1870><s%> that is not good; <S%H2896><s%> He does not despise <S%H3988><s%> evil. <S%H9563><s%>
Thy lovingkindness, <S%H2617><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> extends to the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> Thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> [reaches] to the skies. <S%H7834><s%>

Thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> is like the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of God; <S%H410><s%> Thy judgments <S%H4941><s%> are [like] a great <S%H7227><s%> deep. <S%H8415><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou preservest <S%H3467><s%> man <S%H120><s%> and beast. <S%H929><s%>

How <S%H4100><s%> precious <S%H3368><s%> is Thy lovingkindness, <S%H2617><s%> O God! <S%H430><s%> And the children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> take <S%H2620><s%> refuge <S%H2620><s%> in the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of Thy wings. <S%H3671><s%>

They drink <S%H8248><s%> their fill <S%H7301><s%> of the abundance <S%H1880><s%> of Thy house; <S%H1004><s%> And Thou dost give <S%H8248><s%> them to drink <S%H7301><s%> of the river <S%H5158><s%> of Thy delights. <S%H5730><s%>
For with Thee is the fountain <S%H4726><s%> of life; <S%H9132><s%> In Thy light <S%H216><s%> we see <S%H7200><s%> light. <S%H216><s%>
O continue <S%H4900><s%> Thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> to those who know <S%H3045><s%> Thee, And Thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> to the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart. <S%H3820><s%>
Let not the foot <S%H7272><s%> of pride <S%H1346><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon me, And let not the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> drive <S%H5110><s%> me away. <S%H5110><s%>

There <S%H8033><s%> the doers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> have fallen; <S%H5307><s%> They have been thrust <S%H1760><s%> down <S%H1760><s%> and cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> rise. <S%H6965><s%>
